newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Court confirms Commission decision to reduce Social Funds.
newsitem.headline: Court confirms Commission decision to reduce Social Funds.

text.p: The European Court of Justice confirmed on Wednesday the European Commission's decision to reduce its grant of social funds for training programmes to be carried out in Portugal.
The Commission had approved 80,857,968 escudos for 199 internships, but later learned that the majority of the interns had not been placed in jobs originally agreed to under the funding approval.
The Commission revoked the grant on that basis and because it found certain expenses to be outside the scope of the grant.

The court rejected the appellant's pleas for continued funds based on the principles of legal certainty and legitimate expectation because the appellant knew up front the necessary conditons to receive the grant, and had not fulfilled those conditions.
(Court translation into French. Original language of the case: Portuguese)
Estabelecimentos Isidoro m. Oliveira SA, partie requerante
Commission des Communautes europeennes, partie defenderesse

ayant pour objet une demand d'annulation partielle de la decision C (94) 1410/9 de la Commission, du 12 juillet 1994, notifiee a la requerante le 28 decembre 1994, relative a un concours financier du Fonds social europeen au titre d'une action de formation
